## Lectures
 
Lecture slides, class notes, and problem sets are linked below. New material is added approximately on a weekly basis.

| wk| Topic                    | Packages              | Detailed Topics                                                                 | #M |
|---|--------------------------|-----------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----|
| 1 | Introduction             | base R                | R; IDE; console vs script; working directory; packages; help system              | 1  |
| 2 | R Basics I               | base R                | Objects; atomic vectors; matrices; lists; data frames; naming; inspection        | 1  |
| 3 | R Basics II              | base R                | Subsetting; indexing; type coercion; NA handling; sorting; vector arithmetic; basic plotting | 1 |
| 4 | Programming              | base R                | Conditionals; loops; functions; scoping; vectorization; apply family             | 2  |
| 5 | Data Wrangling           | dplyr; magrittr       | filter; select; mutate; summaries; pipe operator; tidy data; grouped operations | 2  |
| 6 | Importing Data           | readr                 | CSV files; paths; data importing; fread; aggregation; sorting                    | 2  |

| 8 | Probability              | base R                | Probability rules; discrete & continuous models; random variables; expectation; variance; sampling; CLT; simulation | 2 |
| 9 | Statistical Inference    | base R                | Point estimation; standard error; confidence intervals; Monte Carlo inference; bootstrap; resampling logic | 4 |
|10 | Hypothesis Testing       | base R; stats         | Null and alternative hypotheses; test statistics; p-values; significance level; power; bootstrap tests; interpretation | 1 |
|11 | Linear Regression        | stats                 | OLS derivation; assumptions; diagnostics; confidence intervals for coefficients; model selection; multicollinearity | 3 |
|12 | Logistic Regression      | stats                 | Odds; log-odds; likelihood; MLE; classification vs regression; diagnostics; interpretation | 2 |
|13 | Treatment Effects & ANOVA| stats                 | One-way ANOVA; two-factor models; interactions; contrasts; interpretation        | 1 |
|14 | High-Dimensional Data    | base R                | Linear algebra; dimensional reduction; regularization; latent factors         | 3 |
